intro: Xanthomyrtus longicuspis, commonly known as the long-spined myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to eastern Australia, where it typically grows in coastal heathlands and open forests. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Xanthomyrtus longicuspis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It also serves as a habitat for various native insects and birds.
